comment.author: 68439219@N06
comment._content:
Model R version  "Baby Grand" 1910 -   Span 21 feet Approximate Wing Area 140 square feet .  Was test flown by Orville Wright , October 25, 1910  at Belmont Park - New York International Aviation Meet,  in preparation for the Gordon Bennett trophy to be flown October 29, 1910 ,  fastest aircraft in the world.
8 cylinder , 60 hp motor, Orville Wright attained a speed between 70 and 80 Miles per hour. (The Papers of Wilbur & Orville Wright Volume Two 1906-1948)

Notice four wheel configuration

Claude Graham White, Royal Aero Club of Great  Britain won the trophy - average speed
  61.3  miles per hour
